main.name: Julio Maldonado
main.description: I consult business owners on technical solutions, I write custom code to support critical business needs, and I advocate for underrepresented minorities in the tech industry
main.bio: I'm a Mexico-born DACA recipient, TAMU Alumna, and software engineer. I'm passionate about advocating for the undocumended, underserved and underrepresented, as well as solving problems for them. My education has given me incredible opportunities so I use my story to inspire others. On my free time, I enjoy boarding including skateboarding, longboarding, skimboarding, and snowboarding. I'm available for media interviews, speaking events, consulting interesting projects, offering advice, or to just talk - feel free to reach out.
main.contactmessage: Contact me for media interviews, speaking events, consulting, or anything else.

education.school: Waiting for the DACA Decision During the Pandemics: Two Perspectives
education.graduated: Dr. Dilma Da Silva and Julio Maldonado Guzman
education.description: Article co-written with Dr. Dilma Da Silva on the DACA experience during the then upcoming Supreme Court decision in the midst of COVID-19

education.school: GraphBLAS: Solving Graph Algorithms with Linear Algebra
education.description: Published undergraduate thesis on the usage of GraphBLAS, a C library to represent graphs as hypersparse matrices and perform operations in the language of linear algebra, under Dr. Timothy Davis.

testimonials.text: I have been here for almost 4 years. I have been to a lot of incredible events here aimed at bettering the lives of minority groups, but I have never been to one as impactful as today's. Thank you so much for sharing your stories.
